In a digital age where tools define the craftsman, my choice of software is a reflection of my passion, precision, and pursuit of excellence. Every project I undertake is empowered by a curated suite of tools that amplify my skills and sharpen my ideas. Dive in and discover the digital palette I use to paint my professional canvas.

## **Machine Learning & AI Development**

**Deep Learning Frameworks**:

-   *PyTorch*: Primary framework for deep learning research and model development
-   *TensorFlow*: Alternative framework for machine learning projects
-   *Lightning*: PyTorch Lightning for structured ML code
-   *Hugging Face Transformers*: For NLP and transformer models

**Python Ecosystem**:

-   *Python 3.x*: Core programming language
-   *Jupyter Notebook*: Interactive computational environment
-   *Google Colab*: Cloud-based Python development

**Configuration & Versioning**:

-   *Hydra Configuration Framework*: Experiment configuration management
-   *DVC*: Data version control and pipeline automation
-   *TensorBoard*: Visualization for training metrics and model graphs

## **Development Environment**

**Code Editors & IDEs**:

-   *VS Code*: Primary IDE with extensions
-   *RStudio*: Integrated development environment for R
-   *Emacs - Doom Emacs*: Advanced text editing
-   *Notepad++*: Quick text editing

**Environment Management**:

-   *Conda / Micromamba*: Package and environment management
-   *Lightning-Hydra template*: Structured ML experiment template

**Terminal & Shell**:

-   *Windows Terminal*: Modern terminal experience
-   *PowerShell*: Shell scripting on Windows
-   *WSL2 (Ubuntu)*: Linux subsystem on Windows

## **Research & Academic Writing**

**Literature Management**:

-   *Zotero + BetterBibTeX*: Reference management and BibTeX/CSL JSON generation
-   *Google Scholar*: Research discovery and citation tracking
-   *ORCID / Scopus / ResearchGate*: Academic profiles and networking

**Document Preparation**:

-   *Quarto*: Primary tool for presentations, thesis, SLR, and documentation
-   *LaTeX*: ManitThesis.cls, Manit Lab Manual, and custom templates
-   *Pandoc*: Universal document converter
-   *Markdown*: Everyday documentation
-   *tinytex / pdflatex*: PDF generation

**Writing Tools**:

-   *VS Code*: Primary writing and editing environment
-   *Obsidian*: Knowledge management and note-taking

**Diagramming & Graphics**:

-   *TikZ*: LaTeX-based diagrams
-   *Mermaid.js*: Flowcharts and diagrams in Markdown
-   *Draw.io*: Diagramming tool
-   *Inkscape*: Vector graphics and technical diagrams

## **Statistical Computing with R**

**Core R Tools**:

-   *R*: Statistical computing and data analysis
-   *tidyverse*: dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2, purrr, and more
-   *rmarkdown*: Dynamic document generation
-   *pagedown*: HTML résumé and paged documents

**Use Cases**:

-   SLR (Systematic Literature Review) automation
-   CV generation (Excel → R → pagedown pipeline)
-   Statistical analysis and visualization

## **Data Visualization & Graphics**

**Data Visualization**:

-   *Matplotlib*: Static, animated, and interactive visualizations in Python
-   *Seaborn*: Statistical data visualization
-   *ggplot2*: Grammar of graphics in R
-   *Plotly*: Interactive graphing
-   *Tableau*: Business intelligence and dashboards

**Image & Design Tools**:

-   *GIMP*: Raster graphics and photo editing
-   *LibreOffice Draw*: Diagrams and sketches
-   *Microsoft PowerPoint*: Presentations and visual content

## **High-Performance Computing**

**Cluster Computing**:

-   *PBS Job Scheduler*: qsub, qstat for batch job management
-   *SSH / SCP*: Remote server access and file transfer

**Monitoring Tools**:

-   *htop*: Process monitoring
-   *nvidia-smi*: GPU monitoring and management

## **Version Control & DevOps**

-   *Git*: Distributed version control
-   *GitHub*: Code hosting and collaboration
-   *GitHub Actions*: CI/CD automation
-   *DVC*: Dataset and model versioning

## **Productivity & System Management**

**System Management**:

-   *Winget*: Windows package manager
-   *chezmoi*: Dotfile management across systems

**Productivity Tools**:

-   *Raindrop*: Bookmark management
-   *Microsoft Edge*: Primary web browser
-   *Espanso*: Text expansion tool
-   *Slack / Teams*: Team communication

**Cloud Storage**:

-   *Google Drive*: File sharing and backup

## **Content Creation & Outreach**

**Video Production**:

-   *OBS Studio*: Screen recording and streaming
-   *Shotcut*: Video editing
-   *YouTube Studio*: ResearchInfuser channel management

## **Office Suites**

-   *LibreOffice Suite*: Open-source office productivity
-   *MS Office Suite*: Word, Excel, PowerPoint (when required)

## **Automation & Scripting**

-   *Google AppScript*: Automated timetable generation
-   *Excel → R → pagedown*: Automated CV generation pipeline
-   *HTML / CSS / JavaScript*: Web content and automation

### Contributing

These projects are open source and contributions are welcome! Feel free to:

- Report issues or suggest improvements on GitHub
- Submit pull requests with enhancements
- Fork and adapt for your institution's requirements
- Share your use cases and experiences

All projects are licensed under open-source licenses (typically MIT or GPL) to ensure maximum reusability and benefit to the research community.
